title-group.article-title: New Behavioral Paradigms for Virtual Human Models

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2006 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The earliest Digital Human Modeling systems were noninteractive analysis packages with crude graphics. Next generation systems added interactivity and articulated kinematic human models. The newest systems use realtime computer graphics, deformable figures, motion controllers, and user interfaces. Our long-term goal is to free the user as much as possible from interactive human model manipulation through direct understanding and execution of task instructions. We present a next generation DHM testbed that includes a scriptable interface, real-time collision-avoidance reach, empirical joint motion models, a versatile locomotion engine, motion capture and synthetic motion blends and combinations, and a smooth skinned scalable human model.
